pos2definition.definition: myofascial pain is a pain associated with inflammation or irritation of muscle or of the fascia surrounding the muscle.

attributes.isA: a pain
attributes.etiological_factor: with inflammation or irritation of muscle or of the fascia surrounding the muscle

pos2definition.definition: occlusal splint is a bite plane designed and fabricated for patients with some types of functional temporomandibular joint disorders. Provides a stable occlusal platform from which to reconstruct a functional occlusion. See also splint.

attributes.isA: a bite plane designed
attributes.used_for: patients with some types of functional temporomandibular joint disorders

pos2definition.definition: occlusal vertical dimension is the distance between a point on a maxillary tooth and a point on the opposing mandibular tooth during occlusion. Several are used to determine this measurement, including specific facial measurements that have been proved to be equal to the OVD.

attributes.isThe: distance between a point on a maxillary tooth and a point on the opposing mandibular tooth during occlusion

pos2definition.definition: occlusion is the act of closure or state of being closed.

attributes.ability: closure or state of being closed

pos2definition.definition: occlusion is a contact between the incising or masticating surfaces of the maxillary and mandibular teeth.

attributes.isA: a contact between the incising or masticating surfaces of the maxillary and mandibular teeth

pos2definition.definition: bilateral balanced occlusion is the closure suitable for worn dentitions that are cuspless or have flat-sided cusps. It permits an increase of the amount of surface contact in centric closure and provides as much closure contact as possible for horizontal chewing. This kind of occlusion is a therapeutic form designed to keep dentures seated when fine-textured foods are chewed horizontally. It is not found in young, unworn natural dentitions.

attributes.isA: a therapeutic form designed
attributes.isThe: closure suitable for worn dentitions that are cuspless or have flat-sided cusps
attributes.ability: surface contact in centric closure and provides as much closure contact as possible for horizontal chewing
attributes.used_for: keep dentures seated when fine-textured foods are chewed horizontally

pos2definition.definition: centric occlusion is the relation of opposing occlusal surfaces that provides the maximum planned contact and/or intercuspation. It should exist when the mandible is in centric relation to the maxilla. Also called central occlusion.

attributes.ability: opposing occlusal surfaces that provides the maximum planned contact and/or intercuspation

pos2definition.definition: onlay is a cast type of restoration that is retained by frictional and mechanical factors in the preparation of the tooth and restores one or more cusps and adjoining occlusal surfaces of the tooth.

attributes.resort_to: retained by frictional and mechanical factors
attributes.isA: a cast type
attributes.ability: the tooth and restores one or more cusps and adjoining occlusal surfaces of the tooth

pos2definition.definition: onlay is an occlusal rest portion of a removable partial denture that is extended to cover the entire occlusal surface of the tooth.

attributes.isA: occlusal rest portion of a removable partial denture that is extended to cover the entire occlusal surface of the tooth

pos2definition.definition: open contact is an increased area between adjacent teeth without interproximal contacts. It can be due to the abnormal position or absence of the teeth, oral disease, oral habits, or the overdevelopment of the frena. See also frenum and diastema.

attributes.isA: increased area between adjacent teeth without interproximal contacts
attributes.etiological_factor: the abnormal position or absence of the teeth, oral disease, oral habits
attributes.ability: the frena

pos2definition.definition: oral cavity is the mouth.

attributes.isThe: mouth

pos2definition.definition: orthognathic surgery is a surgery to alter relationships of dental arches and/or supporting bones, usually accomplished with orthodontic therapy.

attributes.purpose: to alter relationships of dental arches and/or supporting bones

pronunciation: os鈥瞖oin鈥瞭蓹gra鈥瞫h 蓹n

pos2definition.definition: osseointegration is a term originally defined by Professor P.I. Br氓nemark and commonly used to describe the direct contact, on the light microscopic level, between living bone tissue and an implant, without an intervening fibrous connective tissue layer between the bone and the implant surface.

attributes.isA: a term originally defined by Professor P.I

pos2definition.definition: osteoplasty is a surgical procedure to modify or change the configuration of a bone.

attributes.ability: a bone
attributes.purpose: to modify or change

pos2definition.definition: overdenture is a complete or partial removable denture supported by retained roots that is intended to provide improved support, stability, and tactile and proprioceptive sensation and to reduce ridge resorption. See also root retention and root submersion.

attributes.isA: a complete or partial removable denture supported by retained roots
attributes.purpose: intended to provide improved support, stability, and tactile and proprioceptive sensation and to reduce ridge resorption

pos2definition.definition: horizontal overlap is a projection of the anterior or posterior teeth of one arch beyond their antagonists in a horizontal direction. Also called overjet, overjut.

attributes.isA: a projection of the anterior or posterior teeth of one arch beyond their antagonists in a horizontal direction

pos2definition.definition: vertical overlap is an extension of the maxillary teeth over the mandibular teeth in a vertical direction when the opposing posterior teeth are in contact in centric occlusion. It may also be used to describe the vertical relations of opposing cusps of posterior teeth. Also called overbite.

attributes.isA: extension of the maxillary teeth over the mandibular teeth in a vertical direction when the opposing posterior teeth are in contact in centric occlusion
attributes.can_be: used to describe the vertical relations of opposing cusps of posterior teeth

pos2definition.definition: path of placement is the direction in which a removable dental restoration is positioned in relation to the planned location on its supporting structures. The restoration is removed in the opposite direction. See also placement, choice of path of.

attributes.isThe: direction in which a removable dental restoration is positioned in relation to the planned location on its supporting structures

pos2definition.definition: wax pattern is a wax model for making the mold in which the metal will be formed in casting.

attributes.isA: a wax model for making the mold in which the metal will be formed in casting

pos2definition.definition: wax pattern is a wax form of a denture that, when it is invested in a flask and the wax is eliminated, will form the mold in which the resin denture is formed.

attributes.isA: a wax form of a denture that, when it is invested in a flask and the wax is eliminated, will form the mold in which the resin denture is formed

pos2definition.definition: periodontal disease is a group of inflammatory and infectious diseases affecting the periodontium of the teeth, with various classes noted.

attributes.isA: a group of inflammatory and infectious diseases
attributes.influence: affecting the periodontium of the teeth, with various classes noted

pos2definition.definition: periodontal surgery is an operative procedure used to treat disease or repair abnormalities in the periodontium and associated teeth.

attributes.isA: operative procedure used to treat disease or repair abnormalities in the periodontium and associated teeth

pos2definition.definition: periodontitis is the alterations occurring in the periodontium with inflammation. Gingival changes are those of gingivitis, with the clinical signs associated with gingivitis. It has histologic characteristics, such as ulceration of the sulcular and junctional epithelium, epithelial hyperplasia, proliferation of epithelial rete pegs into the gingival tissues, apical migration of the epithelial attachment after lysis of the gingival fibers, increased cellular and exudative infiltrate, and vascularity of the lamina propria. Resorption of bone in an apical direction results in the loss of attachment of the periodontal fibers to the bone. A transseptal band of reconstituted periodontal fibers walls off the gingival inflammation from the underlying bone.

attributes.isThe: alterations occurring in the periodontium with inflammation
attributes.ability: attachment of the periodontal fibers to the bone

pos2definition.definition: periodontitis is a chronic, progressive disease of the periodontium. Considered under the classification of periodontal disease.

attributes.isA: a chronic, progressive disease of the periodontium

pos2definition.definition: periodontium is the tissues that support the teeth, which include the gingivae, cementum of the tooth, periodontal ligament, and alveolar bone.

attributes.isThe: tissues that support the teeth, which include the gingivae, cementum of the tooth, periodontal ligament, and alveolar bone

pos2definition.definition: placement is the act of placing an object.

attributes.ability: placing an object

pos2definition.definition: occlusal plane is an imaginary surface that is related anatomically to the cranium and that theoretically touches the incisal edges of the incisors and tips of the occluding surfaces of the posterior teeth. It is not a plane in the true sense of the word but represents the mean of the curvature of the surface.

attributes.isA: imaginary surface that is related anatomically to the cranium and that theoretically touches the incisal edges of the incisors and tips of the occluding surfaces of the posterior teeth
attributes.ability: the curvature of the surface
attributes.is_NOT_A: a plane in the true sense of the word but represents

pos2definition.definition: occlusal plane is a line drawn between points representing one half of the incisal overbite in front and one half of the cusp height of the last molars in back. See also curve of occlusion.

attributes.isA: a line drawn between points representing one half of the incisal overbite in front and one half of the cusp height of the last molars in back

pos2definition.definition: sagittal plane is a plane of the body created by an imaginary plane parallel to the median plane.

attributes.resort_to: body created by an imaginary plane parallel to the median plane
attributes.isA: a plane

pos2definition.definition: model plaster is a plaster used for diagnostic casts and as an investing material.

attributes.use_occasion: used for diagnostic casts and as an investing material

pos2definition.definition: polishing is the process of making a surface smooth and glossy or giving luster to a surface, usually by friction.

attributes.ability: making a surface smooth and glossy or giving luster to a surface, usually by friction

pos2definition.definition: polyp is a smooth, pedunculated growth from a mucous surface such as from the nose, bladder, or rectum.

attributes.isA: a smooth, pedunculated growth from a mucous surface such as from the nose, bladder, or rectum

pos2definition.definition: pontic is the suspended member of a fixed partial denture; pontic is an artificial tooth on a fixed partial denture or an isolated tooth on a removable partial denture.

attributes.isA: artificial tooth on a fixed partial denture or an isolated tooth on a removable partial denture
attributes.isThe: suspended member of a fixed partial denture

pos2definition.definition: porosity is the presence of pores or voids within a structure.

attributes.ability: pores or voids within a structure

pos2definition.definition: postoperative care is a care after surgery or other invasive procedures, usually of a supportive nature.

attributes.isA: a care after surgery or other invasive procedures, usually of a supportive nature

pos2definition.definition: premolar is one of the eight teeth, four in each jaw, between the canines and first molars; premolar is usually has two cusps; premolar are the replaces the molars of the primary dentition.
surgical preparation is a surgical procedure that is required for preparing the oral cavity for prosthodontic treatment.

attributes.isA: a surgical procedure
attributes.used_for: preparing the oral cavity for prosthodontic treatment

pos2definition.definition: pressure is a stress or strain that may occur by compression, pull, or thrust; pressure is an applied force.

attributes.isA: a stress or strain; applied force

pos2definition.definition: periodontal probe is a finecalibrated instrument designed and used for measuring the depth and topography of gingival and periodontal pockets. Also used to determine the degree of attachment and adaptation of the gingival tissues to the tooth. Automated devices are now available for dental offices and clinics.

attributes.isA: a finecalibrated instrument designed
attributes.ability: attachment and adaptation of the gingival tissues to the tooth
attributes.used_for: for measuring the depth and topography of gingival and periodontal pockets

pos2definition.definition: alveolar process is the portion of the maxillae or mandible that forms the dental arch and serves as a bony investment for the teeth. Its cortical covering is continuous with the compact bone of the body of the maxillae or mandible, whereas its trabecular portion is continuous with the spongy bone of the body of the jaws. See also ridge, alveolar.

attributes.ability: the maxillae or mandible that forms the dental arch and serves as a bony investment for the teeth; the maxillae or mandible, whereas its trabecular portion is continuous with the spongy bone of the body of the jaws

pos2definition.definition: prognosis is the foretelling of the probable course of a disease; prognosis is a forecast of the outcome of a disease.

attributes.isA: a forecast
attributes.ability: the probable course of a disease; a disease

pos2definition.definition: prognosis is a forecast of the probable result of a regimen of treatment.

attributes.isA: a forecast of the probable result of a regimen of treatment

pos2definition.definition: prosthesis is the replacement of an absent part of the body by an artificial part.

attributes.ability: an absent part

pos2definition.definition: hybrid prosthesis is an implant supported complete denture with a metal framework colloq.

attributes.isA: implant supported complete denture with a metal framework colloq

pos2definition.definition: maxillofacial prosthetics is the branch of prosthodontics concerned with the restoration of stomatognathic and associated facial structures that have been affected by disease, injury, surgery, or congenital defect.

attributes.ability: prosthodontics concerned with the restoration of stomatognathic and associated facial structures that have been affected by disease, injury, surgery, or congenital defect

pos2definition.definition: prosthodontics is the specialty of dentistry pertaining to the diagnosis, treatment planning, rehabilitation and maintenance of the oral function, comfort, appearance, and health of patients with missing or deficient teeth and/or oral and maxillofacial tissues using biocompatible substitutes. This is one of nine recognized specialties in dentistry.

attributes.ability: dentistry pertaining to the diagnosis, treatment planning, rehabilitation and maintenance of the oral function, comfort, appearance, and health of patients with missing or deficient teeth and/or oral and maxillofacial tissues using biocompatible substitutes

pos2definition.definition: radiograph is a two-dimensional representation of a three-dimensional object, produced by radiation of structures. Older term is x-ray.

attributes.isA: a two-dimensional representation of a three-dimensional object

pos2definition.definition: ascending ramus is the posterior, vertical portion of the mandible, which extends from the corpus to the condyle, and makes a joint at the temple. There are right and left ascending rami.

attributes.extend_from: the corpus to the condyle, and makes a joint at the temple
attributes.isThe: posterior, vertical portion of the mandible

pos2definition.definition: reciprocation is the means by which one part of a removable partial denture framework is made to counter the effect created by another part of the framework.

attributes.isThe: means by which one part of a removable partial denture framework
attributes.purpose: to counter the effect created by another part of the framework

pos2definition.definition: interocclusal record is a record of the positional relation of the teeth or jaws to each other; interocclusal record is made on occlusal surfaces of occlusal rims or teeth in a plastic material that hardens, such as plaster, wax, zinc oxide-eugenol paste, or acrylic resin.

attributes.isA: a record of the positional relation of the teeth or jaws to each other
attributes.made_on: on occlusal surfaces of occlusal rims or teeth in a plastic material that hardens, such as plaster, wax, zinc oxide-eugenol paste, or acrylic resin

pos2definition.definition: oral rehabilitation is a restoration of the form and function of the masticatory apparatus condition to as near normal as possible.

attributes.isA: a restoration of the form and function of the masticatory apparatus condition to as near normal as possible

pos2definition.definition: jaw relation is a relationship of the mandible to the maxillae.

attributes.isA: a relationship of the mandible to the maxillae

pos2definition.definition: maxillomandibular relation is any one of the many relations of the mandible to the maxillae, such as the centric maxillomandibular relation or eccentric maxillomandibular relation.
occlusal relationship is the individual and collective relationships of the mandibular teeth to the maxillary teeth and the relationship of the adjacent teeth in the same dental arch.

attributes.isThe: individual and collective relationships of the mandibular teeth to the maxillary teeth
attributes.ability: the adjacent teeth in the same dental arch

pos2definition.definition: relief is the mitigation or removal of pain or distress.

attributes.isThe: mitigation or removal of pain or distress

pos2definition.definition: relief is the reduction or elimination of pressure from a specific area under a denture base.

attributes.isThe: reduction or elimination of pressure from a specific area under a denture base

pos2definition.definition: resin is broad term used to indicate organic substances that are usually translucent or transparent and are soluble in ether, acetone, and similar substances but not in water. They are named according to their chemical composition, physical structure, and means for activation or curing. Examples are acrylic resin, autopolymer resin, synthetic resin, styrene resin, and vinyl resin. See also methyl methacrylate; varnish, cavity.

attributes.occur_position: usually translucent or transparent and are soluble in ether, acetone, and similar substances but not in water
attributes.named_by: their chemical composition, physical structure, and means for activation or curing

pos2definition.definition: acrylic resin is general term applied to a resinous material of the various esters of acrylic acid. It is used as a denture base material and also for trays and other dental restorations.

attributes.used_as: as a denture base material and also for trays and other dental restorations
attributes.used_for: a resinous material of the various esters of acrylic acid

pos2definition.definition: acrylic resin is An ethylene derivative that contains a vinyl group.
thermoplastic resin is a synthetic resin that may be softened by heat and hardened by cooling.

attributes.isA: a synthetic resin
attributes.inducement: be softened by heat and hardened by cooling

pos2definition.definition: root resorption is a destruction of the cementum or dentin by cementoclastic or osteoclastic activity. Also known as peripheral or external root resorption.

attributes.isA: a destruction of the cementum or dentin by cementoclastic or osteoclastic activity

pos2definition.definition: rest is passive support.
rest is an extension from a prosthesis that affords vertical support for a restoration.

attributes.isA: extension from a prosthesis that affords vertical support for a restoration

pos2definition.definition: incisal rest is a metallic extension onto the incisal angle of an anterior tooth to supply support or indirect retention for a removable partial denture.

attributes.isA: a metallic extension onto the incisal angle
attributes.purpose: tooth to supply support or indirect retention for a removable partial denture

pos2definition.definition: lingual rest is a metallic extension onto the lingual surface of an anterior tooth to provide support or indirect retention for a removable partial denture.

attributes.isA: a metallic extension onto the lingual surface
attributes.purpose: tooth to provide support or indirect retention for a removable partial denture

pos2definition.definition: occlusal rest is a rest placed on the occlusal surface of a posterior tooth.

attributes.use_position: placed on the occlusal surface of a posterior tooth

pos2definition.definition: amalgam restoration is a direct restoration made from an alloy consisting of mercury and other metals, which is carved and contoured after placement in the tooth; allow a minimum of 24 hours between placement and polishing.

attributes.isA: a direct restoration
attributes.made_from: an alloy consisting of mercury and other metals, which is carved and contoured after placement in the tooth

pos2definition.definition: ceramic restoration is an indirect restoration made from metal and nonmetal compounds, which is carved and contoured before placement in the tooth; ceramic restoration is closely resembles natural teeth in strength, hardness, chemical inertness, and esthetic appearance.

attributes.isA: indirect restoration
attributes.material_characteristics: resembles natural teeth in strength, hardness, chemical inertness, and esthetic appearance
attributes.made_from: metal and nonmetal compounds, which is carved and contoured before placement in the tooth

pos2definition.definition: implant restoration is the single tooth implant crown or multiple tooth implant, crown, or bridge that replaces a missing tooth or teeth.

attributes.isThe: single tooth implant crown or multiple tooth implant, crown, or bridge that replaces a missing tooth or teeth

pos2definition.definition: retainer is the part of a dental prosthesis that unites the abutment tooth with the suspended portion of the bridge. It may be an inlay, partial crown, or complete crown.

attributes.ability: a dental prosthesis that unites the abutment tooth with the suspended portion of the bridge
attributes.inducement: be an inlay, partial crown, or complete crown

pos2definition.definition: retainer is an appliance for maintaining the positions of the teeth and jaws gained by orthodontic procedures.

attributes.isA: appliance
attributes.purpose: maintaining the positions of the teeth and jaws gained by orthodontic procedures

pos2definition.definition: retainer is the portion of a fixed prosthesis attaching a pontic to the abutment teeth.

attributes.ability: a fixed prosthesis attaching a pontic to the abutment teeth

pos2definition.definition: retainer is a form of clasp, attachment, or device used for the fixation or stabilization of a prosthetic appliance.

attributes.use_occasion: for the fixation or stabilization of a prosthetic appliance
attributes.isA: a form of clasp, attachment

pos2definition.definition: retainer is an orthodontic appliance, fixed or removable, used to maintain teeth in corrected positions during the period of functional adaptation following corrective treatment.

attributes.isA: orthodontic appliance, fixed or removable, used to maintain teeth in corrected positions
attributes.ability: functional adaptation following corrective treatment

pos2definition.definition: direct retainer is a clasp, attachment, or assembly applied to an abutment tooth for the purpose of maintaining a removable restoration in its planned position in relation to oral structures.

attributes.isA: a clasp, attachment
attributes.purpose: of maintaining a removable restoration in its planned position in relation to oral structures
attributes.used_for: an abutment tooth for the purpose

pos2definition.definition: extracoronal retainer is a type of retainer in which the preparation and its cast restoration lie largely external to the body of the coronal portion of the tooth and complement the contour of the crown. The retention or resistance to displacement is developed between the inner surfaces of the casting and the external walls of the prepared tooth. The extracoronal retainer may be a partial crown or a complete crown.

attributes.isA: a type of retainer in which the preparation and its cast restoration lie largely external
attributes.ability: the coronal portion of the tooth and complement the contour of the crown
attributes.inducement: be a partial crown or a complete crown

pos2definition.definition: extracoronal retainer is a direct retainer of the clasp type that engages an abutment tooth on its external surface in such a way as to afford retention and stabilization to a removable partial denture; extracoronal retainer is a direct retainer of the manufactured type, the male portion of which is attached to the external surface of a cast crown on an abutment tooth.

attributes.isA: a direct retainer of the clasp type that engages an abutment tooth on its external surface in such a way as to afford retention and stabilization to a removable partial denture; a direct retainer of the manufactured type, the male portion of which is attached to the external surface of a cast crown on an abutment tooth

pos2definition.definition: indirect retention is a retention obtained in a removable partial denture by placing rests opposite the fulcrum line to create indirect retainers.

attributes.resort_to: by placing rests opposite the fulcrum line to create indirect retainers
attributes.isA: a retention obtained in a removable partial denture

pos2definition.definition: alveolar ridge is the bony ridge of the maxillae or mandible that contains the alveoli. See also process, alveolar.

attributes.isThe: bony ridge of the maxillae or mandible that contains the alveoli

pos2definition.definition: residual ridge is the portion of the alveolar ridge that remains after the alveoli have disappeared from the alveolar process after extraction of the teeth.

attributes.ability: the alveolar ridge that remains after the alveoli have disappeared from the alveolar process

pos2definition.definition: rigidity is the characteristic of being nonflexible, which is essential in a connector, a reciprocal arm, or an indirect retaining unit of a removable partial denture.

attributes.ability: being nonflexible, which is essential in a connector, a reciprocal arm, or an indirect retaining unit of a removable partial denture

pos2definition.definition: occlusion rim is an occluding surface built on temporary or permanent denture bases for the purpose of making maxillomandibular relation records and arranging teeth.

attributes.isA: occluding surface built on temporary or permanent denture bases for the purpose
attributes.purpose: of making maxillomandibular relation records and arranging teeth

pos2definition.definition: rod is a straight, slim, cylindric form of material, usually metal.

attributes.isA: a straight, slim, cylindric form of material, usually metal

pos2definition.definition: rotation is the act of turning about an axis or a center.

attributes.ability: turning about an axis or a center

pos2definition.definition: rotation is a movement of a tooth around its longitudinal axis.

attributes.isA: a movement of a tooth around its longitudinal axis

pos2definition.definition: scanning is a technique and protocol for carefully studying an area, organ, or system of the body by recording and displaying an image of the area using radioactive substances that have affinities for specific tissues.

attributes.resort_to: body by recording and displaying an image of the area using radioactive substances that have affinities for specific tissues
attributes.isA: a technique and protocol for carefully studying an area, organ, or system

pos2definition.definition: shade selection is the determination of the color of the artificial tooth or set of teeth for a given patient. Also called tooth color selection.

attributes.ability: the color of the artificial tooth or set of teeth for a given patient

pos2definition.definition: silicone is a compound of organic structural character in which all or some of the positions that could be occupied by carbon atoms are occupied by silicon; silicone is a plastic containing silicons.

attributes.isA: a compound of organic structural character in which all or some of the positions that could be occupied by carbon atoms are occupied by silicon; a plastic containing silicons

pos2definition.definition: sodium bicarbonate is an antacid, electrolyte, and urinary alkalinizing agent.

attributes.isA: antacid, electrolyte, and urinary alkalinizing agent

pos2definition.definition: soft tissue is a body tissue except bone, teeth, nails, hair, and cartilage.

attributes.isA: a body tissue except bone, teeth, nails, hair, and cartilage

pos2definition.definition: solder is a fusible alloy of metals used to unite the edges or surfaces of two pieces of metal.

attributes.isA: a fusible alloy
attributes.used_for: unite the edges or surfaces of two pieces of metal

pos2definition.definition: pickling solution is a solution of acid used for removing oxides and other impurities from the surface of dental castings, after recovery and before polishing.

attributes.isA: a solution of acid
attributes.ability: dental castings, after recovery and before polishing
attributes.used_for: for removing oxides and other impurities

pos2definition.definition: space is a delimited, three-dimensional region.

attributes.isA: a delimited, three-dimensional region

pos2definition.definition: splint is a rigid appliance for the fixation of displaced or movable parts.

attributes.isA: a rigid appliance for the fixation
attributes.purpose: of displaced or movable parts

pos2definition.definition: splint is a support or brace used to fasten or confine.

attributes.use_occasion: to fasten or confine
attributes.isA: a support

pos2definition.definition: splint is a metal, acrylic resin, or modeling compound fashioned to retain in position teeth that may have been replanted or have fractured roots.

attributes.isA: a metal, acrylic resin, or modeling compound fashioned to retain in position teeth that may have been replanted or have fractured roots

pos2definition.definition: sprue former is a cone-shaped base made of metal or plastic to which the sprue is attached. Forms a crucible in the investment material. Also called crucible former.

attributes.isA: a cone-shaped base
attributes.composed_of: of metal or plastic to which the sprue is attached

pos2definition.definition: stability is the quality of being physically or emotionally predictable, orderly, not readily moved.

attributes.ability: being physically or emotionally predictable, orderly, not readily moved

pos2definition.definition: stem cell are the cells which can divide and differentiate into differing specialized cell types. First reported by McCulloch & Till at Toronto. Stem cells can be obtained from umbilical cord blood, bone marrow, adipose tissue, and blood. They have great potential for cell replacement therapy.

attributes.material_characteristics: be obtained from umbilical cord blood, bone marrow, adipose tissue, and blood

pos2definition.definition: stone is an abrading instrument or tool.

attributes.isA: abrading instrument or tool

pos2definition.definition: dental stone is a 伪-hemihydrate of calcium sulfate.

attributes.isA: a 伪-hemihydrate

attributes.isA: a gypsum product that, when combined with water in proper proportions, hardens in a plasterlike form

pos2definition.definition: stylomandibular ligament is one of a pair of specialized bands of cervical fascia, forming an accessory part of the temporomandibular joint. It extends from the styloid process of the temporal bone to the ramus of the mandible.

attributes.extend_from: the styloid process of the temporal bone

pos2definition.definition: sulcus is a furrow, trench, or groove, as on the surface of the brain or in the folds of mucous membranes.

attributes.isA: a furrow, trench, or groove
attributes.ability: the brain or in the folds of mucous membranes

pos2definition.definition: sulcus is a groove or depression on the surface of a tooth.

attributes.isThe: space between the free gingival margin

pos2definition.definition: occlusal surface is the anatomic superior surface of the mandibular posterior teeth and the inferior surface of the maxillary posterior teeth. These surfaces are limited mesially and distally by marginal ridges, and buccally and lingually by the buccal and lingual boundaries of the cusp eminences.

pos2definition.definition: surgery is a procedure performed by a surgeon.

attributes.isA: a procedure performed by a surgeon

pos2definition.definition: radiographic survey is the production of the minimal number of radiographic examinations necessary for a radiographic interpretation.

attributes.ability: the minimal number of radiographic examinations necessary for a radiographic interpretation

pos2definition.definition: swallowing is a succession of muscular contractions from above downward or from the front backward; swallowing are the propels food from the oral cavity toward the stomach.

attributes.isA: a succession of muscular contractions from above downward or from the front backward

pos2definition.definition: system is a set or series of organs or parts that unite in a common function.

attributes.isA: a set or series of organs or parts that unite in a common function

attributes.isA: a stone or metal occlusal table

attributes.isA: aggregation of similarly specialized cells united

pos2definition.definition: tissue conditioning is a disciplined program of patient-performed plaque control measures designed for gingiva that is soft, spongy, and bleeds easily from poor oral hygiene habits, is performed to improve gingival health before subgingival scaling.

pos2definition.definition: anterior teeth is the incisor or canine front teeth.

pos2definition.definition: posterior teeth is the maxillary and mandibular premolars and molars of the permanent dentition or the premolars and molars of prostheses.

attributes.isThe: maxillary and mandibular premolars and molars of the permanent dentition or the premolars and molars of prostheses

pos2definition.definition: discoloration tooth is a stain or change in color of a tooth, which can be caused by blood-borne pigment or blood decomposition within the pulp, usage of certain drugs, and trauma. See also tooth, pigmentation.

attributes.isA: a stain or change in color of a tooth
attributes.material_characteristics: be caused by blood-borne pigment or blood decomposition within the pulp, usage of certain drugs, and trauma

pos2definition.definition: tooth mobility is the movability of a tooth resulting from loss of all or a portion of its attachment and supportive apparatus. Seen in periodontitis, occlusal traumatism, and periodontosis.

attributes.result_from: from loss of all or a portion of its attachment and supportive apparatus
attributes.ability: a tooth

pos2definition.definition: translation is a movement of a rigid body in which all parts move in the same direction at the same speed.

attributes.isA: a movement of a rigid body in which all parts move in the same direction at the same speed

pos2definition.definition: translucency is an object鈥檚 ability to allow the passage of light through it.

attributes.isA: object鈥檚 ability to allow
attributes.ability: light through it

pos2definition.definition: trauma is a hurt; trauma is a wound; trauma is an injury; trauma is a damage; trauma is a impairment; trauma is a external violence producing bodily injury or degeneration.

attributes.isA: a hurt; a wound; injury; a damage; a impairment; a external violence producing bodily injury or degeneration

pos2definition.definition: impression tray is a receptacle or device that is used to carry impression material to the oral cavity, confine the material in apposition to the surfaces to be recorded, and control the impression material while it sets to form the impression.

attributes.isA: a receptacle or device
attributes.used_for: carry impression material to the oral cavity, confine the material in apposition to the surfaces to be recorded, and control the impression material while it sets to form the impression

pos2definition.definition: treatment is the mode or course pursued for remedial ends.

attributes.isThe: mode or course pursued for remedial ends

pos2definition.definition: brand name : found in products such as Colgate Total; drug class : broad spectrum antibacterial agent; action : inhibits enol-acyl protein reductase, leading to loss of type II fatty acid synthesis; use : combined in an oral product to aid in reducing plaque within the oral cavity.

attributes.brand_names: found in products such as Colgate Total

pos2definition.definition: trifurcation is a division into three parts or branches, as the three roots of a maxillary first molar.

attributes.isA: a division into three parts or branches, as the three roots of a maxillary first molar

pos2definition.definition: trismus are the spasms of the muscles of mastication resulting in the inability to open the oral cavity; trismus is often symptomatic of pericoronitis.

attributes.result_in: the inability to open the oral cavity

pos2definition.definition: genial tubercle is a small rounded elevation on the lingual surface of the mandible on either side of the midline near the inferior border of the body of the mandible, serving as a point of insertion for the geniohyoid muscles.

attributes.function: as a point of insertion for the geniohyoid muscles
attributes.isA: a small rounded elevation on the lingual surface of the mandible on either side of the midline near the inferior border
attributes.ability: the mandible

pos2definition.definition: tuberosity reduction is a surgical excision of excessive fibrous or bony tissue in the area of the maxillary tuberosity before the construction of prosthetic appliances.

attributes.isA: a surgical excision of excessive fibrous or bony tissue
attributes.ability: the maxillary tuberosity before the construction of prosthetic appliances

pos2definition.definition: tumor is a swelling. Through usage the term is now synonymous with neoplasm. See also neoplasm.

attributes.isA: a swelling

pos2definition.definition: odontogenic tumor is a neoplasm produced from tooth-forming tissue. See also calcifying epithelial odontogenic tumor.

attributes.isA: a neoplasm

pos2definition.definition: undercut is the portion of a tooth that lies between its height of contour and the gingivae, only if that portion is of less circumference than the height of contour.

attributes.ability: a tooth that lies between its height of contour and the gingivae, only if that portion is of less circumference than the height of contour

pos2definition.definition: undercut is the contour of a cross-section of a residual ridge of dental arch that would prevent the placement of a denture or other prosthesis.

attributes.effect: prevent the placement of a denture or other prosthesis
attributes.ability: a cross-section of a residual ridge of dental arch

pos2definition.definition: undercut is the contour of flasking stone that interlocks to prevent the separation of parts.

attributes.ability: flasking stone that interlocks to prevent the separation of parts

pos2definition.definition: undercut is the portion of a prepared cavity that creates a mechanical lock or area of retention; undercut may be desirable in a cavity to be filled with gold foil or amalgam but is undesirable in a cavity prepared for a restoration to be cemented.

attributes.ability: a prepared cavity that creates a mechanical lock or area of retention
attributes.inducement: be desirable in a cavity to be filled with gold foil or amalgam but is undesirable in a cavity prepared for a restoration to be cemented

pos2definition.definition: unification is the act of uniting or the condition of being united.

attributes.ability: uniting or the condition of being united

pos2definition.definition: wax is one of several esters of fatty acids with higher alcohols, usually monohydric alcohols. Dental waxes are combinations of various types of waxes compounded to provide the desired physical properties.

attributes.purpose: to provide the desired physical properties

pos2definition.definition: baseplate wax is a hard, pink wax used for making occlusion rims and baseplates for occlusion rims.

attributes.isA: a hard, pink wax
attributes.used_for: for making occlusion rims and baseplates for occlusion rims

pos2definition.definition: boxing wax is a soft wax used for boxing impressions.

attributes.isA: a soft wax
attributes.used_for: for boxing impressions

pos2definition.definition: wax elimination is the procedure of removing the wax from a wax pattern invested in a mold preparatory to the introduction of another material into the resulting cavity. This may be done by dry heat alone or irrigation with boiling water followed by use of dry heat. Also called wax burnout.

attributes.ability: removing the wax from a wax pattern invested in a mold preparatory to the introduction of another material into the resulting cavity
attributes.inducement: be done by dry heat alone or irrigation with boiling water followed by use of dry heat

pos2definition.definition: waxing is the contouring of a wax pattern or the wax base of a trial denture into the desired form. Also called waxing up.

attributes.ability: a wax pattern or the wax base of a trial denture into the desired form

pos2definition.definition: wedge is a small, pointed, triangular, contoured piece of wood used to seal the gingival margin of a cavity preparation before placement of a direct restoration.

attributes.isA: a small, pointed, triangular, contoured piece of wood used
attributes.used_for: seal the gingival margin of a cavity preparation before placement of a direct restoration

pos2definition.definition: wrought wire is a wire formed by drawing a cast structure through a die; wrought wire is used in dentistry for partial denture clasps and orthodontic appliances.

attributes.use_occasion: in dentistry for partial denture clasps and orthodontic appliances
attributes.isA: a wire formed by drawing a cast structure through a die

pos2definition.definition: wrought wire is a form of metal resulting from the swaging, rolling, and drawing of a metal ingot into a desired shape and size.

attributes.result_from: from the swaging, rolling, and drawing of a metal ingot into a desired shape and size
attributes.isA: a form of metal

pos2definition.definition: xylitol is a low-calorie sweetener that reduces caries activity and the growth and transmission of S. mutans.

attributes.effect: reduces caries activity and the growth and transmission of S. mutans
